title: Mycotoxin
summary: A mycotoxin (from the Greek μύκης mykes, "fungus" and τοξίνη toxini, "toxin")[1][2] is a toxic secondary metabolite produced by organisms of kingdom Fungi[3] and is capable of causing disease and death in both humans and other animals.[4] The term 'mycotoxin' is usually reserved for the toxic chemical products produced by fungi that readily colonize crops.[5]
